Alright, so I tried installing this on my first Steam Deck, and everything worked just fine, I clicked the Log In button, it opened the log in page in my browser, and all was well. Then I went to install this on my second Steam Deck, and I COULD NOT get it to log in no matter what I tried... but I found a fix.

Many times the Steam Deck will have issues with flatpaks that all come down to the xdg desktop portal. You can restart it by going into Konsole and running the following:

systemctl restart --user xdg-desktop-portal

I found this information on the SGDBoop page (steamgriddb.com/boop), as I was also having issues getting that to work as well, but that fix works for Plex as well, as it will probably also work for other flatpaks that are experiencing issues.

Login was broken before but I can now sign in from desktop mode with plex.

In this version and older the flatpak does not clean up after itself if not shutdown correctly. Once shutdown unclean the servers pid file is not cleaned up preventing Plex from starting up again unless removed manually. When it works it works well.

Run this command in desktop mode: systemctl --user restart xdg-desktop-portal.service

This allows the plex app to open a browser tab.

description:
As of today (14Aug2022) the app works great. Download and sign in while in Desktop mode (I signed in with Chrome first so it would autoload my login credentials) then after using your pin and logging into a Plex user, go to the config and enable "Automatically sign in" then you can close the plex app. Go to Steam and "Add non-steam game" then add Plex and itll work in Game Mode.

To exit plex in game mode, use the "Steam" button to exit the application.
